answers.author: Paul Rosen
answers.text:
Great question. I was seeking an asnwer to this recently as well. Unfortunately, I didn't come across anything. Maybe in the future ICMA's CPM might come up with a good way to measure and compare this across governments and include it in their report (hint, hint).
It might take a lot of doing, but my best suggestion would be to get a copy of the cost allocation plan for a number of governments you usually compare yourself with and see if you can't pull some numbers from those.

author: K Drummond
text:
I am trying to find actual data or a best practice recommendation for the % spent by city governments on administrative costs (HR, IT, Finance, Legal, Executive, Council, etc.) 
Percentage of operating budgets (not just General Fund all Funds including enterprise funds) 
It could be percentage of something else (Revenue, etc.)
If there is some stratification of by City size (budget, population, etc.) that would be helpful.
City of Bellingham has a population of 80,000 and budget of $180,000,000.
Also need to know what is included and not included in 'administration'.
Thanks.
K. Drummond
City of Bellingham, WA
kdrummond@cob.org
(360) 778-8031
title: % of municipal budget (operating?) used for administation cost?
